titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ravi D. Goel Collection on Yale
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig and staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday April 26, 2019 at 07:15

did.unittitle: Ravi D. Goel collection on Yale

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consist of letters, postcards, photograph albums, and various printed ephemera documenting Yale affiliated individuals and organizations collected by Ravi D. Goel.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 45 (YRG 45), Yale objects and memorabilia.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Ravi D. Goel (Yale College, 1993), 2008-2012.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ravi D. Goel Collection on Yale (RU 1081). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

odd.head: General
odd.p: The collection was formerly titled Yale letters and memorabilia collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consist of letters, postcards, photograph albums, and various printed ephemera documenting Yale affiliated individuals and organizations collected by Ravi D. Goel.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by accession, and chronologically therein.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter to Cambridge University colleague (President?) regarding his son and which college he will chose to go to; Christopher Bridge a recent graduate of Harvard, enjoying some Madeira wine, the comments of Sir Isaac Newton and procurement of books from a fellow at Eton College.

did.unittitle: Mary Welch indenture document signed by David Lee and Ebenezer Gray

dao.xlink:title: Mary Welch indenture document signed by David Lee and Ebenezer Gray

daodesc.p: Mary Welch indenture document signed by David Lee and Ebenezer Gray

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The doument concerns the indenture of Mary Welch, an 8 year old poor female whose father, Jonathan Welch of Lebanon, is deceased. Mary is to be a Maid Servant or Apprentice to David Lee (1674 - 1759) and his wife of Coventry, Connecticut, until she reached the age of 18. Document stipulates Mary's duties and the moral behavior by which she must abide. The document further stipulates the obligations of the Lee family to provide well for Mary, to teach her to read, sew, and to perform the tasks of a Maid Servant, which consisted of standard housekeeping tasks of the day.
Jonathan Trumble [Trumbull] is mentioned in the document.

did.unittitle: Jonathan Trumble (Trumbull) document from court of Justice Isaac Huntington

dao.xlink:title: Jonathan Trumble (Trumbull) document from court of Justice Isaac Huntington

daodesc.p: Jonathan Trumble (Trumbull) document from court of Justice Isaac Huntington

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Document fromthe court of Justice Isaac HuntingtonofNorwich, Connecticut. Signed by Revolutionary War patriot Jonathan Trumble [Trumbull]with the form of spelling in use for the family's name until 1766. This documentwas sent to the Sheriff of New London County ordering him to summon Joshua Woodworth to court to answer to Thomas Danforth for debts owed. Sheriff's deposition and account of court costs on reverse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Woolsey discusses a book missing from his personal library (Edward Buck's "Massachusetts ecclesiastical law" (1866) and the inability of colonial ministers to unite a couple in marriage and the post-1700 law allowing ministers to unite, with magistrates present.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
